author: Patrick Williams
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. Heat the milk in a large pan until just coming to the boil. Blanch the prepared parsnips in the milk for 2-3 minutes and drain well. Transfer the parsnips to a roasting tray, season well and drizzle the oil over. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes until crisp and golden on the outside and cooked through. Drizzle the honey over in the last few minutes, tossing to coat. Serve at once.
ingredients: 1.2 litres/ 2 pints full-fat milk,  6 parsnips, quartered and cored,  1 tbsp vegetable oil,  2 tbsp clear honey,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
